Compare the expression \( E \) with \( abc \). Consider substituting specific small integer values to see if \( E < abc \).

Consider if any inequalities or algebraic identities might aid in simplifying \( E < abc \) (for example, AM-GM inequality or Cauchy-Schwarz inequality).

Determine the symmetric nature of the expression and see if symmetrical arguments (like assuming \( a \leq b \leq c \)) simplify the comparison.

Summarize and combine the findings from previous steps to conclude the possible existence of values for a, b, c to make \( E < abc \) or to negate such a possibility.
